text: Adam Reideborn (born January 18, 1992) is a Swedish professional ice hockey goaltender. He is currently playing with Ak Bars Kazan of the Kontinental Hockey League (KHL). ==Playing career== Reideborn made his Swedish Hockey League debut playing with Modo Hockey during the 2014–15 SHL season. After the 2015–16 season, despite appearing in a career high 32 games he was unable to prevent Modo from suffering relegation, Reideborn opted to remain in the SHL, signing a two-year contract to return to Djurgårdens IF on April 7, 2016. Reideborn was awarded the Honken Trophy as the best goaltender in the 2018–19 SHL regular season. On 24 May 2019, Reideborn left the SHL after his strong season, securing his first contract abroad, agreeing to a one-year deal with Ak Bars Kazan of the KHL. == Personal life == His sister, Sofia Reideborn, played professionally with SDE Hockey in the SDHL. ==Awards and honours== {| class="wikitable" !
